description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d493u","text":"This protocol describes lab processing as well as data processing for the MILLIPLEX‱ Human Cytokine/Chemokine/Growth Factor Panel A - Immunology Multiplex Assay","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DD61BAAA88211F0B2EE0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}
keywords: immunology multiplex assay this protocol, immunology multiplex assay, milliplex, human cytokine, chemokine

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2kvis","text":"Thaw plasma samples completely on ice.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8jsef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"AD397CA0384811ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78vh1","text":"Centrifuge thawed samples at 5000 x g @ 4°C for 10 minutes to remove particulates.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bhccp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"5000","duration":600,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A20D1860385B11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9oebh","text":"Mix well by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"doa0l","text":"Preparation of Quality Controls","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52c2","text":"Before use, reconstitute Quality Control 1 and Quality Control 2 with 250 µL deionized water. Invert the vial several times to mix and vortex. Allow the vial to sit for  5-10 minutes. Transfer the reconstituted Quality Control 1 and Quality Control 2 into two polypropylene microfuge tubes. Unused portion may be stored at -20 °C for up to one month.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":350,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"17v4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"8383F060384E11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bn09k","text":"Preparation of Antibody-Immobilized Beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cec0t","text":"For individual vials of beads, sonicate each antibody-bead vial for 30 seconds in an ultrasonic waterbath; vortex for 1 minute. Add 60 µL from each antibody-bead vial to the Mixing Bottle and bring final volume to 3.0 mL with Bead Diluent. Vortex the mixed beads well. Unused portion may be stored at 2-8 °C for up to one month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93ema","text":"Example 1: When using 24 antibody-immobilized beads, add 60 µL from each of the 24 bead vials to the Mixing Bottle. Then add 1.56 mL Bead Diluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"399t","text":"Preparation of Wash Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u2mn","text":"Bring the 10X Wash Buffer to room temperature and mix to bring all salts into solution. Dilute 60 mL of 10X Wash Buffer with 540 mL deionized water. Store the unused portion at 2-8 °C for up to one month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcl5p","text":"Preparation of Serum Matrix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al1i6","text":"Add 1.0 mL deionized water to the bottle containing lyophilized Serum Matrix. Mix well. Allow at least 10 minutes for complete reconstitution. Leftover reconstituted Serum Matrix should be stored at -20 °C for up to one month.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":226,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eeqe1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"A26A3F70384E11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qee7","text":"Preparation of Human Cytokine/Chemokine/Growth Factor Panel A Standard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eks67","text":"Prior to use, reconstitute the Human Cytokine/Chemokine/Growth Factor Panel A Standard with 250 µL deionized water. Refer to table below for analyte concentrations. Invert the vial several times to mix. Vortex the vial for  10 seconds. Allow the vial to sit for 5-10 minutes. Transfer the reconstituted Positive Control into a polypropylene microfuge tube. This will be used as Standard 7; the unused portion may be stored at -20 °C for up to one month.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":453,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eol67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"AD97BA80384E11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c1i2","text":"Preparation of Working Standards ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"snmfi","text":"Label 6 polypropylene microfuge tubes Standard 1 through Standard 6. Add  200 µL of Assay Buffer to each of the 6 tubes.  Prepare serial dilutions by adding 50 µL of the reconstituted standard to the Standard 6 tube, mix well and transfer 50 µL of Standard 6 to the Standard 5 tube, mix well and transfer 50 µL of Standard 5 to the Standard 4 tube, mix well and transfer 50 µL of Standard 4 to the Standard 3 tube, mix well and transfer 50 µL of Standard 3 to the Standard 2 tube, mix well and transfer 50 µL of Standard 2 to the Standard 1 tube and mix well. The 0 pg/mL standard (Background) will be Assay Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"romhb","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"720sd","text":"Diagram the placement of Standards 0 (Background), Standard 1 through  7, Controls 1 and 2, and Samples on Well Map Worksheet in a vertical configuration.  (Note: Most instruments will only read the 96-well plate vertically by default.)  It is recommended to run the assay in duplicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ecvh","text":"Allow all reagents to warm to room temperature (20-25 °C) before use in the assay.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbdsj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"89D8B1E0385C11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"24","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4461","text":"Add 200 µL of Wash Buffer into each well of the plate. Seal and mix on a plate shaker for 10 minutes at room temperature (20-25 °C).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d6868","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EB53F200385B11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"400","start":null,"temperature":"24","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bptbg","text":"Decant Wash Buffer and remove the residual amount from all wells by inverting the plate and tapping it smartly onto absorbent towels several times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej1mo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9if3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ctu7h","text":"Add 25 µL of Assay Buffer to the sample wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fbpa","text":"Add 25 µL of appropriate matrix solution to the background, standards, and control wells. When assaying serum or plasma, use the Serum Matrix provided in the kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eke4s","text":"Add 25 µL of Sample (neat) into the  appropriate wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcjc1","text":"Vortex Mixing Bottle and add 25 µL of the Mixed or Premixed Beads to each well using a multichannel pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"737bg","text":"Seal the plate with a plate sealer. Wrap the plate with foil and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker   overnight (18 hours)  at 2-8 °C. Alternatively, incubate for 2 hours  at room temperature (20-25 °C).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":210,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4v1h1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"29EA1720385B11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"400","start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"CBFA24D0385411ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qr6s","text":"Gently remove well contents and wash plate 3 times following instructions below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qj0a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tcfm","text":" Magnetic plate washer (Cat. No. 40-094, 40-095, 40-096 and 40-097)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aifqb","text":"Rest plate on magnet for 60 seconds to allow complete settling of magnetic beads.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgbvv","text":"Remove well contents by aspiration.  Wash plate with 200 µL of Wash Buffer by adding Wash Buffer, shaking for 30 seconds  , letting beads settle for 60 seconds   and removing well contents as previously described after each wash.  Please note that after the final aspiration, there will be approximately 25 µL of residual wash buffer in each well. This is expected when using the BioTek‱ plate washer and this volume does not need to be aspirated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":120,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":160,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":386,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ecub1","text":"from the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j658","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"2112792E385D11ED9A700A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"21127804385D11ED9A700A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"2112789E385D11ED9A700A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7AA2120DC9F011EE8CCA0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26gac","text":"Add 25 µL of Detection Antibodies into each well using a multichannel pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92mhm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1i0bp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":77}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"49man","text":"Allow the Detection Antibodies to warm to room temperature prior to addition. {"blocks":[{"key":"d51fd","text":"Seal, cover with foil and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 1 hour at room temperature (20-25 °C). {"blocks":[{"key":"b4987","text":"Add 25 µL Streptavidin-Phycoerythrin to each well containing the 25 µL of Detection Antibodies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o7do","text":"Seal, cover with foil and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 30 minutes at room temperature (20-25 °C). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ehju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"481C1F70385D11ED979E95A787621B4E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"400","start":null,"temperature":"24","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeo6h","text":"Run plate on Luminex‱ 200‱ instrument with xPONENT® software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"211344FDC9F111EE8CCA0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"211344FDC9F111EE8CCA0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gt4t","text":"Save and analyze the Median Fluorescent Intensity (MFI) data using a 4-parameter logistic curve-fitting method for calculating analyte concentrations in samples (Belysa 1.2.1 Software - Millipore).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"danb4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ee7md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6veql","text":"The Millipore kit includes two Quality Controls (QC1 - lower concentration \u0026 QC2 - higher concentration) for each analyte. It is essential that, for every assay, these quality controls align with the specified range set by Millipore for each analyte. Failure to meet the specified ranges for any analyte during a run will result in the exclusion of that analyte from the report. The QC ranges can be found at the top of the raw data report for each analyte.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eu0g","text":"Raw data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k4jb","text":" Analyte concentrations from each well are measured twice (since the assay is ran in duplicate). The raw data Excell file has the following tabs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74vnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h7q7","text":"Summaries tab: This tab contains the mean analyte concentrations from the two measurements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l37v","text":"Analyte-Specific Tabs: Each of these tabs is dedicated to a single analyte and displays the individual concentration results for the two measurements from each well.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hr0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97ff7","text":"Processed Data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57nmj","text":"The raw data is first processed by core G, followed by an additional processing round by the data science core. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfjhc","text":"Core G Processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ptsh","text":"The analyte concentration summaries from the \"Summaries\" tab of the raw data are imputed with","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bhd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56qdn","text":"\"ND\": If the analyte concentration falls below the limit of detection (LOD).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfmkk","text":"\"%MFIe\": The analytes CV% of the MFI is above 30%. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ggbt","text":"\"QCe\": The quality controls (QC1 and QC2) fall outside of the range specified by Millipore for the specific analyte.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ujvp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"574ub","text":"Then, the summaries with the imputed values are split into the Sample Data tab, QC Data Runs tab, and the Internal Cntrl data tab. Two additional tabs are included to explain the imputed values (Data key \u0026 explanation)  and the minimum detectable concentrations for each metabolite (Imputed ND values).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v6dl","text":"Data Science Core Processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3umr9","text":"Analyte concentrations for each sample are taken from the Sample data tab of the core G processed data and matched with the HML_ID for the participant. Then the following transformations were made on the data. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aqj1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bab6l","text":"Analytes labeled \"ND\" were replaced with 1/2 of the LOD. Millipore provided the LOD for each analyte. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ke0j","text":"Analytes labeled \"%MFIe\" were replaced with the batch average concentration for that analyte. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n78q","text":"Analytes that were imputed with \"QCe\" are left missing (NA).  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"936n4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7cc0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
